channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 'Windows 11 25H2 edges ahead of Windows 10 in gaming performance': testing proves newer OS is faster — but there's an elephant-sized BSOD in the room
item.description: Think Windows 10 is faster than Windows 11 for gaming? You're dead wrong, based on a new test — but I'm betting this won't sway Windows 10 holdouts.

item.title: Samsung’s new cheap OLED TV for 2026 looks set to get a big brightness boost — but there will be a catch
item.description: LG's OLED SE screen seems to the coming to Samsung's S85H – if that's confusing, allow me to explain…

item.description: There's a big pot of digital gold out there.

item.title: Payments processing pitfalls to avoid when going cloud-first
item.description: Stability has long since been treasured in finance but now we see disruption everywhere...

item.title: Intel revient dans la course : des puces pour Nvidia et des MacBook dès 2028 ?
item.description: On pensait TSMC indétrônable et Intel relégué au second plan, mais la géopolitique et les pressions américaines rebattent les cartes. D'ici 2028, Nvidia et Apple pourraient bien confier une partie de leurs puces au géant de Santa Clara, mais pas n'importe lesquelles.

item.title: Apple Creator Studio is now available for $13 per month: What's included and what it means for creators
item.description: Services have been a huge part of Apple’s business for the past several years — to the tune of tens of billions of dollars in revenue last year alone. Now, with the new Apple Creator Studio bundle, the company is leaning harder into the professional creative software space. Apple Creator Studio packages a bunch of the company’s pro apps into a single subscription service that you can pay monthly or yearly for. It’s officially available starting January 28, and includes a one-month free trial. The key shift is that some of these apps are now subscription-only on iPad, even as Apple continues to...

item.title: Windows 10 regagne du terrain sur Windows 11, mais pourquoi ?
item.description: Un peu plus de trois mois après la fin officielle du support de Windows 10, ce dernier gagne des parts de marché au détriment de celles de Windows 11.

item.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026: Plus-one passes are almost gone and only 3 days remain
item.description: The TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 plus-one passes at 50% off are almost sold out, and this deal ends in 3 days. Register here before this deal ends on Friday, January 30 at 11:59 p.m. PT.

item.title: Beyond Meat’s protein soda might be its last chance and best hope
item.description: Beyond Meat just launched a new product that's even further from meat than ever before: a protein soda. Beyond Immerse is the company's first product that makes no attempt to replicate meat whatsoever, marking a sharp shift in Beyond's business model. It might seem like it comes out of left field, but it all clicks […]

item.description: The Sony WH-1000XM6 Wireless Headphones are some of the best headphones around, offering great audio performance, exceptional noise cancellation and a comfy design – and they're now back to a record-low price on Amazon.

Standing around 3.5-feet tall, Sprout's design, featuring a soft padded exterior, a wide head, and expressive mechanical eyebrows, was inspired by some of science fiction's friendlier robots like Baymax and Rosie Jetson, the startup's […]...

item.description: Google teste une fonctionnalité inédite dans son navigateur Chrome pour PC. Si elle s'avére utile sur le papier, elle pourrait faire plus de mal que de bien.

item.title: Xiaomi vide ses stocks avant la fin des soldes : les 17 offres à retenir
item.description: Pour la dernière semaine des soldes, il est encore possible de tomber sur de très bons deals, notamment chez Xiaomi. De nombreux de ses produits sont en promotions, et si une des dernières références de la marque vous fait de l’oeil, c’est l’occasion de profiter des nombreuses offres.

item.title: Soldes d’hiver 2026 : les 20 bons plans de la dernière démarque qui crèvent l’écran sur les téléviseurs et les vidéoprojecteurs

item.title: Adaptive6 emerges from stealth to reduce enterprise cloud waste (and it's already optimizing Ticketmaster)
item.description: The generative AI era has sped everything up for most enterprises we talk to, especially development cycles (thanks to "vibe coding" and "agentic swarming").But even as they seek to leverage the power of new AI-assisted programming tools and coding agents like Claude Code to generate code, enterprises must contend with a looming concern — no, not safety (although that's another one!): cloud spend. According to Gartner, public cloud spend will rise 21.3% in 2026 and yet, according to Flexera's last State of the Cloud report, up to 32% of enterprise cloud spend is actually just wasted resources ...

item.title: Marathon DualSense PS5 controller pre-orders build-up live — the best info and links ahead of the new hardware launching tomorrow
item.description: We've got all the best information and links for the new Marathon Limited Edition PS5 controller and Pulse Elite headset, so you can bag your new accessory with ease.

item.title: AI vs. AI: Using intelligence to solve the energy strain of data centers
item.description: The challenge is no longer just about replacing fossil fuels with renewables. It is about re-architecting entire systems to balance soaring digital demand with emissions goals.

item.title: Après les morts de Minneapolis, Tim Cook, Sam Altman et la tech US sortent prudemment du silence
item.description: Les grands patrons de la tech très proches de Donald Trump ont fini par se rebiffer… sagement. Les événements de Minneapolis, où deux personnes sont mortes sous les coups de feu de la police de l'immigration ont fini par faire réagir plusieurs personnalités, dont Sam Altman et Tim Cook.

item.title: This fanny pack robot helped me walk miles
item.description: Oops, I did it again: I wore an exoskeleton to the world's biggest tech show, walking the streets and casinos of Las Vegas with a robot powering my legs. I don't mean I briefly tried a new gadget there. I mean that for the second year in a row, robotic legs helped me walk the […]

item.title: TurboTax Deluxe is 44 percent off ahead of tax season
item.description: Tax season is fast approaching, and unfortunately for 2026, Direct File isn't an option anymore. The free, government-provided service was shut down, so you'll need to look to other federal programs, including IRS Free File, to file your paperwork. If you don't qualify for Free File, TurboTax might be your best bet for a relatively cheap, efficient way to file your taxes. While it pains us to suggest you give money to a company that has spent decades lobbying to ensure America's tax system remains a nightmare, we can at least help you save a bit of cash if you've determined TurboTax is a neces...

item.title: Le nouveau roi de l’entrée de gamme ? Motorola lance un smartphone à 319€ avec un capteur 108 Mpx et une résistance militaire
item.description: Dans la foulée de son G67, Motorola dégaine une version plus musclée : le moto g77. Pour 319 euros, ce nouveau modèle tente une incursion vers le haut du panier de l'entrée de gamme en combinant un capteur 108 Mpx, une certification militaire et un écran ultra-lumineux.

item.title: Apple aims to keep iPhone 18 price flat in face of RAM shortage, Kuo says
item.description: Apple will try to avoid raising iPhone 18 prices "as much as possible" in the face of a global memory shortage, according to a report from supply chain analyst Ming-Chi Kuo. According to Kuo, Apple plans to "absorb the costs" of rising RAM prices, while at least keeping the iPhone 18's starting price steady. Kuo […]

item.title: L'Univers à l'écran au XXIe siècle : un livre sur une rencontre entre arts et sciences
item.description: En 1959, le chimiste britannique C. P. Snow a donné une mémorable conférence intitulée Les Deux Cultures (en anglais, The Two Cultures) dans laquelle il avançait la thèse qu'au moins de son temps, trop souvent la vie intellectuelle de l'ensemble de la société occidentale se divisait...

item.title: Samsung is making its next e-paper display from plankton — yes, really!

item.description: Armor 30 Pro rugged phone is just £339 and delivers multi-day battery life, dual screens, and extreme durability.

item.title: March 28 ‘No Kings’ protests will shift focus as outrage escalates over Trump’s immigration crackdown in Minneapolis
item.description: Rallies planned for March 28 are expected to be the ‘largest in American history’. A third round of “No Kings” protests is coming this spring, with organizers saying they are planning their largest demonstrations yet across the United States to oppose what they describe as authoritarianism under President Donald Trump.Previous rallies have drawn millions of people, and organizers said they expect even greater numbers on March 28 in the wake of Trump’s immigration crackdown in Minneapolis, where violent clashes have led to the death of two people.“We expect this to be the largest protest in Ame...

item.title: Amazon says it is laying off 16,000 employees
item.description: This is Amazon's second layoff after the company cut 14,000 corporate jobs in October.

item.title: Uber’s founder wants to disrupt your apartment
item.description: As more young, wealthy people choose to rent, Sekra aims to give them what they want: luxury living, game nights, and blackout shades. Tech founder and provocateur Travis Kalanick made millions betting on key parts of the young adult lifestyle with Uber (transportation) and dining (ghost kitchen startup CloudKitchens). Can he hit a trifecta with a bet on tech-focused, community-driven apartments? ...

item.title: Apple TV offers first look at Ted Lasso season 4
item.description: Last year fans of Ted Lasso received the good news that the show would be returning for a fourth season, despite having referred to its third season as its "final" one. Now Apple TV has shared some still images and further confirmation that production is underway. As first shared by The A.V. Club, this latest batch of still images depicts the eponymous coach back in action, this time coaching a women’s soccer team. A description of the upcoming season shared with the outlet reads, “In season four, Ted returns to Richmond, taking on his biggest challenge yet: coaching a second division women’s ...

item.title: Get the Disney+ and Hulu bundle for one month for only $10
item.description: The peak time for deals on streaming services — the holiday shopping season — has come and gone, but Disney is back with a fresh offer for the new year. New and eligible returning subscribers can get one month of the ad-supported Disney+ Hulu bundle for just $10. That's $3 off the usual monthly rate for the bundle, and more than 58 percent off if you consider the prices for each service individually (Disney+ at $12 per month and, separately, Hulu also at $12 per month). We'd be remiss if we didn't mention that this isn't quite as good as the Black Friday deal we saw last year, which offered th...

item.description: Google lance une nouvelle formule d'abonnement plus accessible pour Gemini 3. Les offres payantes de ChatGPT prennent beaucoup de retard.

item.title: Snap is turning its smart glasses team into its own company
item.description: Snap is launching a separate business for its upcoming Specs augmented reality glasses in a bid to lure new investors to the project. The new company, aptly named "Specs," will operate under Snap as a distinct subsidiary ahead of the long-awaited public launch of Specs glasses later this year. "Establishing Specs Inc. as a wholly-owned […]

item.title: Snap is spinning off its AR glasses into a separate business
item.description: Snap’s augmented reality glasses business will now be its own entity, with the company establishing Specs Inc. as a wholly owned subsidiary. It will enable Snap to more easily secure investors and partnerships for its wearables, as well as to grow Specs into a distinct brand while running it within Snap Inc. As The Information reported in mid-2025, Snap was thinking of ways to raise outside money for its AR glasses to be able to better compete with Meta, which has a lot more money to spend on development. It was already considering spinning off the business back then.“Specs are launching at an...

item.title: LinkedIn will let you show off your vibe coding expertise
item.description: LinkedIn has long been a platform for showing off professional accomplishments. Now, the company is leaning into the rise of vibe coding by allowing users to show off their proficiency with various AI coding tools directly on their profiles.The company is partnering with Replit, Lovabl, Descript and Relay.app on the feature and is working on integrations with fellow Microsoft-owned GitHub as well as Zapier. LinkedIn has always allowed users to add various skills and certifications to their profiles. But what makes the latest update a bit different is that users aren't self-reporting their ow...

item.title: Écran Amoled ultra lumineux pour moins de 250 euros, voici le Motorola moto g67
item.description: Motorola rafraîchit son catalogue avec le nouveau moto g67. Entre un écran AMOLED 1,5K particulièrement lumineux et une fiche technique équilibrée, le constructeur américain entend bien consolider ses positions sur le segment très disputé du milieu de gamme.

item.description: One of Apple TV's biggest hits is returning later this year: the streamer confirmed that season 4 of Ted Lasso will premiere this summer. There's no firm date beyond that, but the announcement marks an important moment for the service, as the show, which is one of Apple TV's most popular series, has been dormant […]

item.title: « Trop c’est trop ! » : Ubisoft entre en guerre avec lui-même
item.description: La situation se détériore à vue d'œil chez Ubisoft. Quelques jours après la refonte annoncée par le patron Yves Guillemot, la société pourrait bien faire face au plus grand mouvement de grève de son histoire.

item.title: Amazon enterre Amazon One, le paiement par la paume de la main
item.description: La purge chez Amazon se poursuit. La charrette de licenciements annoncée aujourd'hui s'accompagne de la fermeture du réseau d'épiceries Amazon Go et Amazon Fresh, et plus étonnant, de l'arrêt de la technologie Amazon One qui permet de payer simplement en présentant la paume de sa main. Celle-ci était pourtant prometteuse.

item.title: Smokey Bones and Johnny Rockets restaurant closures: See list of doomed locations after FAT Brands bankruptcy
item.description: The owner of Fatburger and more than a dozen other brands is the latest restaurant company to seek Chapter 11 protection. Here’s what to know. Another day, another announcement of restaurant closures in the casual-dining space.
